reviews.review: Riveting story and great gameplay. Burial at Sea ties well into the first two games

A mis 21 horas de juego solo puedo decir una cosa, no dudes en conseguirlo, en mi opinión este y sus anteriores juegos son una obra de arte, los puntos en los que más destacan son en la calidad visual, inmersión y la historia. Si quieres tener una experiencia realmente gratificante con este juego recomiendo jugar o haber jugado los 2 anteriores primero ya que en Bioshock Infinite se responden muchas cosas tanto en la historia principal de este como con los DLC Burial At Sea o Panteón Marino en español.

si no puedes comprarlo porque no tienes el dinero o simplemente deseas probarlo antes de adquirirlo descargalo desde este sitio web, quieres?: https://www.zona-leros.net/search?q=bioshock

Нет, игра прекрасна! Сюжет особенно! но мля dlc clash of colosus такая сука евонина что просто пзд!"
Например задание 3.8 "убить 6 ублюдков за 60 сек" 4 убиваешь остальных мля не найти сука или вот: 
2.10 убить врагов из дробовика, наскока или отражателя, вроде бы просто, но один какой ни-буть долба... 
обязательно упадет в низ, или конченный ракетчик кого-то убьет, и задание провалено! ачивкадрочерам вроде меня не рекомендую!

While this has Bioshock in the name, this feels very different to the previous two titles. No longer are you crawling in the broken down Rapture, now you're literally above the clouds in a bright city that I had to lower the brightness of because it hurt my eyes, Gone are the days of being able to hold an entire weapon wheel of weapons, now you're limited to 2 weapons. There's loads of changes here and there just make this feel so different overall, but if viewed in isolation, this does not detract from a fun gaming experience. 

The Burial at Sea DLC that came with the Bioshock bundle is definitely worth playing through as well. They don't take especially long and they work to expand on the story of the games series in general. Highly recommended to play through after you're done with the main story.

Bioshock Infinite is a fun FPS with an intriguing story and a beautifully crafted world. In many ways, its themes are timeless and still holds its own as an almost 10 year old game. This game (within the Bioshock bundle) also goes on sale a few times annually, so I recommend getting it when that time comes.

エリザベス可愛い。
スクショ見たときは「とくに好みじゃない」と思ってたけど…
動き、仕草、表情がイチイチやたら可愛らしい。
ゲーム進行そっちのけでエリザベス魅入ってしまう。
こんなに動き回る同行NPCを初めて見た。

「最大の敵はクラッシュとフリーズ」のリマスターを終えて、
もうあんなのはたくさんだし吹替ないから2はスルーしてこっちをプレイ。
クラッシュもフリーズも無いだけで神ゲー感じてしまうが、いやこれが正常だよね。

ストーリー直接繋がっていないのがむしろプレイしやすい。
前作までを知らなくても全然問題ないでしょう。

武器種多めだが2つしか持てない…。
現地調達的に倒した敵からや彼方此方に置いてあるのを拾い替えしながら使い分ける感じ。
弾丸やアイテム類も(くまなく探せば)潤沢に手に入るので節約はあまり考えなくてよい。

メニュー類やキネトスコープなどが妙に小さいのが…、なんでこんななんだ？
UIが洗練されていないのが欠点。

闭环剧情，的确神作。
有任务指引，对路痴很是友好。
游戏性稍差，就1代有BOSS战，2、3代更注重剧情。
尤其海葬DLC武器补给少得可怜，需要潜伏暗杀，倒是剧情把1、2、3代全连了起来。

Outstanding.

剧情晦涩难懂，尤其是dlc，战斗玩着没劲就不说了，场景美术阴暗重复跑图又太多，剧情想搞懂也只能事后上网搜解析，体验很割裂，故事还可以，游戏就算了，真不好玩。
游戏是好游戏，能惊掉我下巴那么好的游戏，不愧被称为第九艺术。但是这游戏怎么老闪退啊？换了太电脑也闪退，后来得知这是游戏的毛病。本着好游戏不能错过的原则推荐大家购买NS版的游玩。其他主机版本没试过，请试过的玩家指教。
真正的第八艺术，买不了吃亏买不了上当

- En en kötü olan da maalesef sağlam bir  Boss Fight yok.

Such a massive shift in terms of visualization and easy of game play from the previous 2 Bioshock games. It is racy, filled with surprises and the companionship Elizabeth and Booker share is quite nice. I feel like the Salts deplete too quickly for some of the vigors but that is a minor criticism for this larger than life, adventurous and action packed game. Definitely a recommendation to all Bioshock fans to play this one.

Очень интересный и любопытный компаньон, игра по моему мнению перегружена механиками(это большое количество способностей и оружия), которые во время компании не успеваешь освоить, но для этого есть дополнение. Игра имеет отличную картинку и оптимизацию, играть на ноутбуке без перегрева оного, чудесно.

Been thinking about it for a while and the game may do many things right i cant bring myself to recommend it.

Oh where to begin il start with the positives and story, story-wise i dont think iam qualified to say my opinion on the game, mainly because its a taste thing, i dont necessirily think its poorly written but the fact it has time travel/parallel worlds and all that shit, 9 times out of 10 i end up hating these stories and the same thing happened with Bioshock infinite, but still there are some good moments here and there i thought the main twist was a bit predictable, booker dewitt and elizabeth are amazing characters even the side characters/villains are great aswell, so all in all the story is not my cup of tea despite the pacing being all over the place, i still managed to appreciate the characters and i vastly prefer this story over the one from bioshock 2, its a problem that i can overlook. 

The setting and visual design is drop dead beautiful i really loved the fact that its not taking place in rapture but it takes place in the sky and i really loved the fact that it was also lively with multiple npcs. 

Elizabeth is one of the greatest video game companions ever, the way she interacts with the environments, help you with supplies during combat is simply incredible its just sad that this awesome AI does not carry to the enemies but il get there shortly.

Skyline is a very fun mechanic. 

So the question is where does Bioshock infinite fails and falls apart? well its in the gamepaly/game design to begin with unlike its predecessors Infinite is far more linear, the past games were well structured giving you a lot of room to explore that rewards you incredibly well and objecitvely speaking linearity is not bad what so ever like some idiots make it out to be, linear games like RE4 and Half life 2 are widely considered some of the best games ever because of how these games nailed the linear game design bioshock infinite on the other hand fails miserably in that regard.

The games i had mentioned earlier spice things up in many ways to keep them from becoming stale and repetitive, bioshock infinite is extremely repetitive, all you do is fight a group of enemies, pull a lever/open door/press a button, watch a story segment, rinse and repeat and thats it, no interesting puzzles, very few unique encounters, barebones exploration and limited interactivity with the world, it feels like a beautiful art that you can only look at but cant interact with.

Combat is very generic it may get the job done but sadly it didnt feel like a step forward compared to bioshock 2, but like i mentioned earlier 99% of the gameplay is you fighting waves of enemies over and over again, the switch to two weapons was a very dumb design choice to pander to more modern FPS games, plasmids were just okay nothing completely new or unique.

Enemy variety was really bad this is a key area that Bioshock 2 improved on but sadly this game does not, its especially a problem since this game tries way to hard to be an arena shooter, the fact that it tries to be a linear shooter is not bad but compare it to something like Doom eternal where the gameplay loop is polished to perfection with well designed enemies and encounters, Bioshock infinite sadly does not even come close to that level of quality as an arena shooter. 

Enemy AI is fucking stupid, its quite baffling to see how stupid they are in comparison to elizabeth's smart AI. 

Elizabeth's tear manipulation is an interesting mechanic but it really does not add any depth to the gameplay at all, its one of these things that the developers had great ideas for but couldnt execute it properly due to budget or development time.

i dont like how its connected to the original Bioshock game.

As someone who has been playing single player games for over 20 years i can easily see that there were very high ambitions for this game and most of these great ideas ended up on the chopping block and all we got is a skeleton of these ambitions and the fact that ken levine left right after this kinda shows it.

Not saying that Bioshock infinite is a bad game im pretty sure it will grab some people, to me Bioshock 1 was a game that proves that video games is the greatest storytelling medium by managing to flawlessly combine story telling and interactivity, Bioshock infinite gets rid of key aspects that made the original bioshock such a masterpiece by completely ignoring the mediums greatest strength and thats interactivity.

9/10

[h1] UN JUEGO ATEMPORAL [/h1]
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[b] [i]Bioshock infinite hace honor a su nombre siendo uno de esos juegos que no importa en que año lo juegues, el juego pasara desapercibido al paso del tiempo, pues envejecio bastante bien gracias a su Historia y jugabilidad . [/i]
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
*La historia del juego es uno de los aspectos q mas destaca esta entrega pues los personajes y ambientes son tan increibles y unicos q literalmente todo es una obra de arte andando.

*Su jugabilidad de un shooter con todo tipo de armas y mejoras para cada una ,mezclada con una estrategia de uso de poderes (tambien mejorables) y un campo de batalla lleno de herramientas para pelear de la forma mas dinamica posible hacen que todo solo se  limite a las habilidades del jugador pudiendo asi volver a intentar y armar nuevas estrategias o modo de pelea SIEMPRE.[/b]
游戏性上或许不够完美，只能说优秀程度，但艺术设计和剧情的惊艳非常值得体验。

The story takes place in the floating city of Columbia, where religious and political influences are at play. You play as Booker Dewitt, a private investigator who also happens to have impressive combat abilities due to the fact he was a soldier prior. He is tasked with retrieving a girl named Elizabeth so that his debts would be wiped away.

This game was definitely a fun experience. There are a variety of skills (called Vigors in the game) that you could unlock by playing through the game. You won't be able to miss any, and all of them have their own distinct uses. Another noteworthy thing is that you could combine the usage of two vigors to create fun and deadly combos. One example would be using Bucking Bronco to make enemies levitate then using Undertow to grab an enemy mid-air to throw them off the edge of the floating city.

The base game's atmosphere is totally different from the previous Bioshock games. The connection between this game and its predecessors doesn't seem to be clear at first, but playing through the DLCs will explain it. Though, I think this game should be a separate game unrelated to the previous games as it takes place in a completely different setting with a new set of characters.

I would recommend playing this game for those interested in a fun shooter game with a decent story. The voice acting and dialogue between characters are top notch as well. Note that playing the first two games isn't really necessary as the main campaign doesn't really reference it much or at all.
